Talented stars, killer physiques. At age 62, "Big Bill" shares his wisdom to dominate one of the ultimate strength marks. Follow these fit women we're crushing on for inspiration, workout ideas, and motivation. Small [diet changes](https://www.muscleandfitness.com/muscle-fitness-hers/hers-features/diet-and-exercise-tricks-look-leaner-3-days/) can make a big [difference](https://www.muscleandfitness.com/muscle-fitness-hers/hers-nutrition/transformation-meal-plan/). To keep your metabolism (and taste buds) humming, you'll introduce a [variety of new foods](https://www.muscleandfitness.com/muscle-fitness-hers/hers-nutrition/5-best-foods-fuel-your-metabolism/) into your diet every two weeks. Each phase includes two new recipes. These healthy, easy meals will help you resist cravings and keep your diet on track. Protein will remain steady throughout the eight-week program to ensure you're not sacrificing muscle. You'll reduce [calories](https://www.muscleandfitness.com/muscle-fitness-hers/hers-workouts/simple-ways-burn-more-calories/) slightly each phase. But reducing your calorie intake doesn't have to be painful. To ensure you're still getting enough fuel for good workouts, you'll maintain a moderate intake of healthy fats throughout all phases. Aim to consume roughly 16 cups (1 gallon) of water over the course of the day. Consuming large amounts of water over a short period of time can make you feel physically full and interfere with your eating plan; be sure to spread out your water and write it down in a food diary so you can stay on top of your intake. 1 of 4 2 of 4 3 of 4 4 of 4
